Head, Admin Job at Eta Zuma Mining and Industries Limited




        
    

        
        Eta Zuma Mining and Industries Limited provides premium solutions to businesses in the primary and secondary sectors of the economy, especially those in solid minerals, extractive industry, manufacturing industry and agriculture. Some of its clients are Zuma 828 Coal Limited, IMEX Mineral Resources and Processing Company, Zuma Energy Nigeria Limited, Zuma Steel W/A Limited, and Zuma Metals & Energy Resources Limited.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Admin

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Shall conduct a need analysis and develop terms of reference of the Admin Department.
	Overseeing Day-to-Day Operations in the Admin department by providing strategic leadership for the organization.
	Plan and coordinate administrative procedures while putting systems in order to devise ways to streamline processes.
	Shall develop and update departmental policies where needed.
	Shall supervise the coordination of the entire Units in the Administrative department.
	Monitor costs and expenses to assist in budget preparation.
	Shall be responsible for training of Administrative Staff.
	Shall build and maintain healthy business relationships with stakeholders while ensuring that EZM and CCs is compliant with relevant regulatory bodies.
	Preparing and reviewing the department’s reports.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree or HND in Public Administration, Business Administration, Office Management, or a related field. A Master's degree or professional certification in office management or administration is a plus.
	Minimum of 8-10 years of progressive experience in administrative roles, with at least 3-5 years in a leadership or managerial capacity overseeing administrative functions.
	Experience in a fast-paced corporate environment is preferred.


Key Skills:


	Strong knowledge of facility and asset management practices.
	Excellent vendor and utility provider negotiation and management skills.
	Proficient in MS Office tools and basic accounting for reconciliations.
	Excellent organizational, leadership, and coordination skills.
	Strong documentation and reporting abilities.

Accounts / Financial Controller Job at Swift Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Swift Consulting Limited - Our client, an Education, Human Resources and Management firm, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounts / Financial Controller

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	They are currently seeking qualified and well-experienced applicants to fill the role of Accounts / Financial Controller for one of our clients in the Oil & Gas sector.


Major Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Liaise with external stakeholders such as auditors, banks, and regulatory bodies.
	Manage a team of finance professionals.
	Oversee the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and reports.
	Monitor and manage budgets, forecasts, and cash flows.
	Ensure compliance with financial regulations and tax laws applicable to the oil & gas industry.
	Supervise accounts payable/receivable, payroll, general ledger, and banking activities.
	Coordinate internal and external audits.
	Provide financial insight and analysis to support strategic decisions.
	Implement and maintain internal control systems.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (MBA or M.Sc. is an added advantage).
	Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience, with at least 3 years in a senior financial role within the oil & gas industry.
	ICAN, ACCA or equivalent professional certification is mandatory.
	Strong knowledge of financial reporting, budgeting, and tax laws.
	Proficiency in financial software and ERP systems (e.g., SAP, QuickBooks, Sage).
	Excellent analytical, leadership, and communication skills.
	High level of integrity and attention to detail.


Salary
N400,000 - N500,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hireme@swiftconsulting.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
